perturbation.original_text: "Add-On Software Modules" means those computer software programs that (a) provide additional functionality and may be integrated with the existing Hardware and other Software, (b) may be legally exported to the Territory without any export license and (c) WGT elects to include in Exhibit A at a mutually agreed discount percentage.
perturbation.changed_text: "Add-On Software Modules" means those software components that may enhance functionality, and may or may not integrate with existing hardware or other software. Exportability and inclusion in Exhibit A are at the sole discretion of WGT and subject to future agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modification replaces specific criteria for add-on software modules with vague terms, creating uncertainty. Exportability is now discretionary, contradicting export regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Export Administration Act, regulations of the U.S. Department of Commerce

perturbation.original_text:
4.  Independent Contractor. Distributor is an independent contractor, not an
     employee, agent or franchisee of WGT. Distributor will not represent or
     hold itself out as an employee, agent or franchisee of WGT. Distributor
     does not have any authority to, and will not, create or assume any license,
     warranty or other obligation, express or implied, on behalf of WGT. This
     Agreement will not be interpreted or construed as creating or evidencing
     any association, joint venture or partnership between the parties or as
     imposing any partnership or franchisor obligation or liability on either
     party.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Independent Entity. Distributor is an independent entity. Distributor has the authority to create obligations on behalf of WGT, but WGT has the right to refuse the action afterward. This Agreement will not be interpreted or construed as creating or evidencing any partnership.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'independent contractor' to 'independent entity' and granting authority to create obligations contradicts the definition of an independent contractor, potentially blurring the line between contractor and agent under agency law. The line is blurred even more by introducing retroactive rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Agency Law, principles governing independent contractor relationships

perturbation.original_text:
14.  Warranty; Returns. WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing
     through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the
     limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or
     limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and
     end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions.
     In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall
     deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be
     defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to
     Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written
     explanation of the alleged defect within thirty (30) days from the later of
     Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT or from the delivery
     of such Product to an end-user.
perturbation.changed_text:
14. As-Is; No Returns. All products are sold as-is. Distributor nor end-users purchasing
     through resellers are permitted to return any Product for any reason whatsoever. There are no warranties, express or implied. WGT will not provide any remedies for defects, damages, or any other issues related to the Product.
perturbation.explanation: Completely negating warranty and return rights contradicts consumer protection laws. The original text specified warranty according to law, the modified is the opposite.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws, Warranty Law (e.g., Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act in the U.S.)
